quiz-data.titleText: The alt attribute is used in a(n) __________ element to provide an alternate __________ description for the image
text: The alt attribute provides alternative information for an image if a user for some reason cannot view it (because of slow connection, an error in the src attribute, or if the user uses a screen reader)

quiz-data.titleText:
The following is a list inside an HTML document:
<ol>
<li id= "a1"> item1 </li>
<li id= "a1"> item1 </li>
</ol>
And it uses the following CSS rules:
#a1 {margin-bottom: 10px;}
#a2 {margin-top: 5px;}
Then when the list is displayed in a browser, the actual margin between
"item1" and "item2" will be ___
text: The top and bottom margins of blocks are sometimes combined (collapsed) into a single margin whose size is the largest of the individual margins (or just one of them, if they are equal), a behavior known as margin collapsing.

quiz-data.titleText: To refer to an external CSS file within an HTML document, use:
text: The <a> (anchor) tag is used to create hyperlinks in HTML. It allows you to link to other web pages, resources, or locations
The <style> tag in HTML is used to define inline CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) within an HTML document
The <script> tag is used to include JavaScript code within an HTML document
To link an external CSS file to an HTML document, you can use the &ltlink> element within the <head> section of your HTML file. Here's how you do it

text: The "marks" array is defined with values [90, 85, 70, 99, 75].
The "add5marks" function is called with the "marks" array as an argument.
Inside the "add5marks" function, a for-in loop iterates over the indices of the array (0, 1, 2, 3, 4), and each element in the array is increased by 5.
The "marks" array is modified to [95, 90, 75, 104, 80] within the "add5marks" function.
Finally, the "console.log" statement is executed, displaying the modified "marks" array with values separated by colons: "95:90:75:104:80."
